cont.entity_a: Works with laptops from 2005 onwards, but not with older models due to modem incompatibility. Compatible with older Mac systems using specific OS versions. Not suitable for newer laptops with built-in wireless connectivity. Not compatible with some older operating systems like Windows 98 SE. Works well for old laptops with outdated internal adapters. Compatible with a variety of public and home WiFi systems.
cont.entity_b: The N card works well with a Netgear dual band router.

cont.entity_a: Easy installation process requiring only driver installation. Installation is quick and straightforward. Can be challenging to install on Linux and older Windows accounts. Installation is easy but can cause conflicts with proprietary software.
cont.entity_b: Setup process can be difficult with known IP address issues. Installation is smooth and quick with proper guidance. Installation is generally easy and maintains a stable connection.

cont.entity_a: Achieves a maximum speed of 54 Mbps in optimal conditions, with reduced speeds over longer distances and through obstructions. Offers solid connections at decent speeds, suitable for older systems.
cont.entity_b: Range and speed are subpar. Provides faster speed and broader coverage than previous cards.

cont.entity_a: Signal strength can fluctuate without user intervention. Provides good range and connectivity even through obstructions.
cont.entity_b: Received as a refurb, but performs excellently with strong signal reception.

cont.entity_a: Incompatible with certain encryption methods, requiring password protection to be turned off for functionality. Supports WPA security, upgrading from older WEP protocols.

Software.comm: Better to use Windows wireless management.

cont.entity_a: Software can be intrusive. Recommended for users with sufficient technical knowledge to avoid software conflicts.

cont.entity_b: Technical support is ineffective. Customer service for product issues is unsatisfactory.

cont.entity_a: Well-packaged and promptly delivered by the seller.

cont.entity_b: Causes high CPU usage with no known fix.
